risks.name: India Tariff Increases
risks.description: India could raise DFTP to 10-15% or beyond
risks.mitigation: Model at 10-15% duty; maintain cost discipline; focus on non-price differentiation

risks.name: Tanzania Export Restrictions
risks.description: Tanzania may restrict oil exports for domestic food security
risks.mitigation: Early government engagement; commit 15-20% of output to domestic market at fair price; negotiate written export permits (3-5 years)
risks.historical_context: Tanzania imports 290K MT oil/year, creates supply sensitivity

risks.name: Regional Supply Volatility
risks.description: Weather dependency, smallholder side-selling, seasonal concentration
risks.mitigation: Multi-country sourcing (Zambia, Malawi, Uganda, Kenya); 6-month buffer stock (10-12M working capital); crop insurance partnerships; flexible production at 50-70% capacity during low season

risks.name: Smallholder Quality Inconsistency
risks.description: Variable post-harvest practices, aflatoxin contamination, farmer side-selling
risks.mitigation: Contract through cooperatives (not individual farmers); farmer training programs; pre-delivery quality testing; input financing; price floor guarantees; provide drying equipment
risks.quality_standards: Max 12% moisture, <50 ppm aflatoxin, <10% foreign matter

risks.name: Large Competitor Price Competition
risks.description: Argentina (53% soybean share), Russia/Ukraine (55-60% sunflower share) could aggressively price-compete
risks.tanzania_impact: Low; can differentiate on non-price factors
risks.mitigation: Differentiate on non-GMO, origin traceability, consistency; establish long-term contracts (3-5 years) with major refiners; ISO 9001 + FSSAI certification; emphasize supply security vs Black Sea risk
risks.positioning: Premium quality + stability vs commodity pricing

risks.name: Foreign Exchange Volatility
risks.description: Revenue in USD, operating costs in local currencies; potential 20% currency swings
risks.mitigation: Natural hedge (USD revenue, local currency costs); price commodity inputs in USD; use forward contracts for large shipments; operational efficiency focus
risks.natural_hedge: Most costs are fixed/sunk; variable costs don't fluctuate symmetrically with currency

risk_summary.tanzania_recommendation: All risks are manageable with proper planning and mitigation strategies
risk_summary.decision_implication: Tanzania maintains advantage even when accounting for risk premium
